This possesses wonderful balance and leaves lasting, lemon-flavored sweetness.
title: Gunter Triebaumer 2015 Beerenauslese Chardonnay (Burgenland)

description: Fresh aromas of pomegranate and raspberry meet with loads of sagebrush and wild mint on the layered and alluring nose of this bottling by Billy Wathen and crew. Flavors of smashed wild berries, dewy herbs, blistered tomato and forest floor moss show on the sip—a great balance between earth and fruit.
title: Foxen 2016 Melville Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A candied black-cherry aroma meets with wild thyme, dried marjoram and tea leaves on the nose of this bottling by Winemaker Blair Fox. It's light bodied on the palate, allowing elegant red-fruit and purple-flower flavors to ride the vibrant acidity into the finish.
title: Fess Parker 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Malmsey is the old English name for Malvasia grapes, which produce a supersweet style of Madeira. Toffee, caramel and dried fruits are shot through with acidity. This is a beautiful wine, aged in wood since the harvest, and ready to drink.
title: Blandy's 1977 Malmsey Malvasia (Madeira)

description: Named after Alphonse Edmond, the father of present owner of Alphonse Mellot, this is the top wine from an always-impressive estate. Richness and concentration almost overwhelm the wine at this young stage, showing that it is set for aging. The acidity and biodynamically grown fruit of this powerful wine need to open up. Drink from 2020.
title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Edmond  (Sancerre)

description: The longtime grape-growing Sangiacomo family has partnered with winemaker James MacPhail to produce this beauty. A floral aroma carries to the balanced, full-bodied palate of Asian pear, fig and pineapple flavors, finishing on a crème caramel note.
title: Sangiacomo 2016 Green Acres Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Immense concentration rises headily from the glass, projecting musk, lemon and crushed banana peel. The twin forces of sweetness and acidity then attack the palate with undiminished vigor, unraveling their power play across the tongue with notions of Mirabelle plum jam and candied lemon. Precision and vigor imbue this with longevity. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Rosenhof 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: Intensity is tantamount in this wine, starting with focused aromas of black raspberry, sun-warmed rose petals, spice cake and a slate-driven minerality. There is a strong acidic zip to the sip before it settles into a smooth groove, loaded with spice-soaked mulberry, Luxardo cherry and clove flavors.
title: Roar 2016 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This balanced wine is sumptuous with ripe fruit while also being seriously structured. It is packed with ripe berry flavors that are lifted by the acidity and filled out with tannins. This wine with its perfumed, mineral edge should age well. Drink from 2028.
title: Quinta do Mourão 2016 São Leonardo Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a delectably fruity, concentrated wine, full of candied orange peel, melon, peach and pineapple flavors. Sweet honey tones penetrate deeply, balanced by fresh lemon-lime acidity. Hints of green banana and a lacy, delicate coating of sugar linger long on the finish. Delicious now but structured enough to improve for decades.
title: Pfeffingen 2016 Beerenauslese Scheurebe (Pfalz)

description: Firm, perfumed and structured this is wine with a fine future. Its firm tannins are beautifully integrated with the generous black fruits and lightened by acidity. It is a very fine wine that will age slowly and impressively. Drink from 2028.
title: Noble & Murat 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: The nose on this blend of 61% Cabernet Sauvignon, 21% Merlot, 8% Cabernet Franc, 5% Petit Verdot and 5% Malbec is showy at first with candied black currant, but then it is elegantly straightforward, with layers of violet. It's tightly wound on the palate, with a clean yet taut structure and pitch-perfect acidity, carrying purple-fruit and dried herb flavors, all expertly integrated.
title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2014 Piocho Reserve Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: This site-specific wine justifies its singularity in a robustly perfumed, floral aroma and a spicy, savory embrace of black tea and cardamom. The fruit profile is defined by rhubarb and orange zest.
title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram West Slope Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: One of two flagship wines from this producer, this is named after the founder of the company. It shows all the elegance and style for which the house is known. Mature fruit, a touch of brioche and toast, and a dry aftertaste all make for an impressive wine that is ready to drink.
title: Deutz 2007 William Deutz Brut  (Champagne)

description: The wine has structure, swathes of juicy fruit and acidity along with fine tannins. It is certainly balanced with deliciously luscious fruit, and a rich texture that is suggesting good aging potential. Drink from 2028.
title: Cockburn's 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: Pressed rose, sunbaked earth, aromatic herb, new leather, balsamic notes and a whiff of game are just some of the aromas you'll find on this multifaceted red. The full-bodied palate boasts structure and personality, delivering dried Marasca cherry, blood orange, star anise and tobacco set against a backbone of firm noble tannins. Drink 2022–2032.
title: Cavallotto 2012 Vignolo Riserva  (Barolo)

description: Co-winemakers Véronique Drouhin-Boss and Isabelle Dutartre call this “the story of our friendship in a bottle,” and what a fine bottle it is. It's a full throttle wine, thoroughly expressing the richness and power of the best Oregon Pinot Noirs. Dense and detailed around potent black cherry fruit, it extends itself with lovely threads of toast and coffee, from fermentation with native yeasts, and aging in roughly one-third new French oak.
title: Caballus 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Ripe black fruits shine through the rich tannins of this perfumed wine. It has a fine juicy character, balanced with the generous tannins and acidity. This is a full-bore wine, likely to be ready to drink from 2028.
title: Burmester 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: Beautifully mature, this rich wine shines with the minerality and texture of Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs. Its intensity and concentration make for a ripe while toasty wine, crisp and deliciously in balance. Drink now.
title: Boizel 2007 Joyau de France Brut Chardonnay Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This blends a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon with 6% Cabernet Franc and smaller amounts of Petit Verdot and Merlot, fermenting the entirety in barrel. Black pepper, leather and rough-hewn, grippy tannin dominate elusive black fruit, pencil shavings and cedar, all within a context of sizzling intensity. This is one to age; enjoy best 2024–2034.
title: Alpha Omega 2014 ERA Red (Napa Valley)

description: A 100% varietal wine from a sacred site in the heart of the appellation, this shows broad, savory flavors of black plum, black currant, leather saddle and tobacco. A lingering thread of black and white pepper dots the landscape of full-bodied richness and complexity. The structure promises further aging; enjoy best from 2024–2034.
title: Alpha Omega 2014 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: This is a finely perfumed wine with swathes of ripe berry fruits and a generous texture. A dry style of vintage, it emphasizes spice, the bite of the spirit as well as the opulent black-plum and raisin fruit flavors. There is great potential in this fine wine. Drink from 2027.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: Sourced entierly from grand cru vineyards and aged for 10 years before disgorgement, this wine is beautifully mature. Richness comes from the ripe fruit rather than the dosage, balanced by tangy acidity and a toasty note. It is a finely poised and impressive wine that is ready to drink.
title: Pommery 2004 Cuvée Louise Brut Nature  (Champagne)

description: Rose, iris, baking spice, menthol, new leather and a whiff of truffle are just some of the enticing scents you'll find in this fragrant red. The palate is all about finesse and tension, offering wild strawberry, crushed raspberry, star anise and chopped mint framed by taut, refined tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2021–2033.
title: La Spinona 2013 Bergera  (Barolo)

description: This brilliantly balanced wine opens with tones of orange and nutmeg, slowly evolving in the glass to reveal rose petal, lavender and crunchy black cherry. This will continue to mature nicely in bottle; enjoy 2020–2025.
title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Juicy, luscious and with excellent ripe fruit, this is a balanced wine with a fine future. Its tannins are almost sweet to match the sweetness of the berry fruits. As it ages, this will be a lovely wine. Drink from 2027.
title: Croft 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: This driest style of Madeira intensified all the characters of this remarkable wine. It is bone dry, with wood flavors, enormous acidity and total concentration. It is a real sipping wine, demanding attention with its intensity, lemon peel and smoky flavors. Drink now.
title: Cossart Gordon 1985 Sercial Sercial (Madeira)

description: Perfumed and loaded with finesse, this single-vineyard wine opens with enticing scents of violet, ripe black-skinned fruit, new leather and baking spice. Made with 60- to 100-year-old plants, the smooth, delicious palate delivers succulent Marasca cherry, plum, licorice and nutmeg framed in velvety tannins, making it one of the more elegant expressions of Taurasi out there. A mineral note energizes the lingering finish. Drink through 2032.
title: 95pointsContrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2012 Vigne d'Alto  (Taurasi)Cellar Selection

description: Though more black-fruited than the Basalt Block bottling, this expresses to an even greater degree the minerality that typifies all Brittan Pinots. Dense, concentrated blueberry compote and black cherry come with residual flavors of astringent, dry stones. The mouthfeel is wonderfully textured and complex, yet detailed. It should provide pleasure for at least a decade; drink now through 2030.
title: 95pointsBrittan Vineyards 2015 Gestalt Block Pinot Noir (McMinnville)Cellar Selection

description: Dark, concentrated aromas of blackberry, vanilla and leather saddle are rich and complex. As expected from Alabaster, the palate is saturated and dense, with rubbing tannins that need more time to soften. A bounty of toasty blackberry, peppercorn and chocolate flavors lead to a finish of toast and coffee. Drink from 2020–2030.
title: 95pointsTeso La Monja 2015 Alabaster  (Toro)Cellar Selection

description: Golden peach, blossom honey, candied lemon and ripe apricot already suggest the lusciousness that is to follow. The sweetness and concentration are immense, but a lively dash of orange and lemon freshness adds much needed zest and pulls this all into a lip-smacking finish. Drink until 2035.
title: Steindorfer 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Grand Cuvée White (Burgenland)

description: Wild strawberry, pressed rose, dried aromatic herb and a potpourri of dark culinary spice are just some of the aromas you'll find on this well-structured wine. On the tightly knit palate, taut yet polished tannins frame flavors of raspberry compote, black cherry, licorice, graphite and a hint of orange rind. It's balanced but still young, so give it a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2022–2030.
title: Prunotto 2012 Riserva Bussia Vigna Colonnello  (Barolo)

description: Underbrush, charred earth, spiced plum, tobacco and star anise are just some of the aromas you'll find on this delicious red. It's enveloping yet structured, delivering dried black cherry, licorice and cocoa set against a backbone of velvety tannins. Hold for even more complexity. Drink 2022–2032.
title: Mastroberardino 2012 Radici Riserva  (Taurasi)

description: Showing its age well, this wine offers a mature toastiness balanced by rich red fruit. The acidity is well integrated, making this impressive wine ready to drink now.
title: Louis Roederer 2002 Cristal Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: Made by Cayuse assistant vigneron Elizabeth Bourcier, this wine is a blend of 54% Grenache, 36% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Syrah—the only one of its kind in the appellation. The aromas leap up, with notes of earthy funk, campfire, moist earth, sea salt, cherry, peat and crushed rock. The raspberry and earth flavors are light and juicy, showing a lot of delicacy as well as depth and detail. Tobacco and raspberry notes linger on the insanely long finish that opens up, broadens, expands and sails with grace.
title: La Rata 2015 Red (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: Packed with fruit while hinting at mature toastiness, this wine is now in perfect balance. Its white fruits are from half-and-half Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, shot through with acidity while having a ripe character. Rich while also crisp, it is ready to drink.
title: Henriot 2008 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: From the producer's site which is situated at 1,800-feet in elevation, this is a beautifully put together wine, blended with 14% Petit Verdot and 5% Malbec. It serves to celebrate the soil, exuding strong elements of sage, earth, graphite and crushed rock. Amidst the terroir is a richness of blackberry, clove and chocolate. Full bodied, it retains structure and grace.
title: Chappellet 2014 Pritchard Hill Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Luminous lemon freshness dominates the nose of passion fruit on this tropical Auslese. Sauvignon Blanc's varietal greenness—think tomato leaf and grass—edge and shape the wonderfully luscious midpalate, while spiky, sharp freshness delivers satisfying thrill. What lovely, flavor-bursting passion fruit tension. This crackles with life.
title: Weixelbaum 2016 Wahre Werte Wechselberg Himmel Auslese Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)

description: A black, firm and rich wine, this is immense and with enormous concentration. It is balanced with a strongly floral edge as well as a touch of acidity. The dark fruits give the wine richness while the tannins promise longevity. Drink this very fine wine from 2028.
title: Quinta do Silval 2016 Magalhães Vintage  (Port)

description: The aromas are exultant in notes of fire pit, ham hock, green olive, mineral, peat, soot, sea breeze, steak tartare, coffee bean and potpourri. The palate is full of intensely rich yet still vibrant, savory flavors and an abundant peppery tone. The olive and fire-pit finish easily lingers for a minute, if not beyond.
title: Horsepower 2015 The Tribe Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: This is the top Chardonnay from this producer, offering a deep golden hue, lush, aromatic fruit tones and flat out decadent flavors. Beautifully layered with concentrated notes of peach, apricot and pear, it dives deeper into seams of butter, toasted nuts, coffee and caramel. A most powerful and utterly delicious wine.
title: Domaine Serene 2015 Récolte Grand Cru Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

description: Enticingly fragrant, this gorgeous wine opens with classic Nebbiolo aromas of woodland berry, wild rose, forest floor, pipe tobacco, dark spice and a balsamic whiff of menthol. Reflecting the nose, the delicious, structured palate delivers dried cherry, raspberry compote, truffle, star anise and a note of crushed mint. Firm but noble tannins provide the framework and bestow impressive aging potential. Drink 2022–2037.
title: Cavallotto 2012 Bricco Boschis Vigna San Giuseppe Riserva  (Barolo)

description: Densely textured with dusty tannins and full of black plum skin and prune flavors, this is a ripe, complex wine. Its sweeter character does not spoil the great structure and dry core that will allow this exemplary wine to age. Drink from 2029.
title: 96pointsPoças 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a juicy wine, with dense black fruits that are cut by bright acidity. The tannins give power and long-term aging potential to this impressive wine. Drink from 2028.
title: Warre's 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: Structured, vibrant and boasting extreme elegance, this radiant Nebbiolo opens with enticing scents of iris, violet and crushed aromatic herb. The chiseled palate has wonderful intensity and precision, delivering red cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and Lessona's classic salty finish. It's still young and nervous but impeccably balanced, with taut, refined tannins and firm acidity. Give it time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2023–2043.
title: 96pointsProprietà Sperino 2012  LessonaCellar Selection

description: This is a blend of old tawnies from the 1920s and 1930s with some from 1900. It was bottled to celebrate the company's 380th anniversary in 2018. The wine tastes old, but there is some extraordinary freshness as well. Bitter-orange marmalade comes through the old-gold wood flavors while the intense acidity is stunning. Drink now, sip by sip.
title: Kopke NV CNK 380 Very Old Tawny  (Port)

description: The domaine name means “without category,” and it is no doubt apt. The nose offers compelling notes of ember, olive tapenade, blackberry bush, flowers, ham hock, broken rock and smoke. The palate is full, rich and layered, showing an impeccable sense of balance and structure that carries through the extremely long, salty, meaty, smoky, tapenade-filled finish. A profound wine, with a long life in front of it. Best from 2025–2034.
title: Hors Categorie 2015 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: Dark mulberry, black raspberry and slate start the nose of this bottling from one of the region's most coastal vineyards, but then comes a tremendous amount of black sage, Earl Grey tea and the slightest touch of game on the nose. Dark-berry flavors are cut by thyme and lavender on the palate, which is rich yet fresh, tart and lovely.
title: Foxen 2016 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is a rich, intense and dense wine. Aging in wood has concentrated the ripe fruit, bringing an old-gold character to the wine. It is supremely rich with flavors of molasses and also tight with great acidity. Drink this superb wine now.
title: Cossart Gordon 1989 Bual Bual (Madeira)

description: A smokiness lies thickly above the apple fruit notes of this heady TBA, glossing everything with a darker, brooding presence. That same smoky darkness hovers on the palate, but here the spiky, bright spur of lemon freshness breaks through triumphantly, lending drive and precision to the apricot and Mirabelle plum fruit that spreads its lusciousness across the tongue. This is rich, concentrated, intense and beautifully unusual. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Rosenhof 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Chardonnay (Burgenland)

description: This is a luscious wine. Its tannins are cushioned by the ripe plum and prune fruits. That doesn't mean it is likely to develop too quickly, but is ready to take its time, bringing out the opulent character of the wine as well as its structure. Drink from 2028.
title: Kopke 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: Subtle aromas of black-skinned berry, rose, sea breeze and wet rock shape the nose. On the elegant, full-bodied palate, velvety tannins and vibrant acidity provide structure and finesse for juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and a salty mineral note. It's full bodied but also irresistibly weightless. Drink 2021–2031.
title: 96pointsFranchetti–Passopisciaro 2016 Contrada S Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)Cellar Selection

description: With grapes coming from the Chardonnay heartland of the Côte des Blancs, this wine is the epitome of structured, textured fruit but with the essential addition of age. Still hinting at freshness and still textured, the wine is also rich with white-fruit flavors cut with limes. Drink from 2020.
title: Billecart-Salmon 2006 Cuvée Louis Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Breathtaking aromas of luscious yellow peach, saffron and honey introduce this laser-light Auslese. Bold lemon acidity and delicate sweetness lend a finely filigreed feel to the palate, balanced out by luscious layers of sweet peach, apricot and apple. The finish is endless. Gorgeous already, but a wine to treasure for decades to come.
title: Zilliken 2016 Rausch Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Big tannins coupled with dark fruits have produced a powerful wine with a long-term future. The wine has a dense structure, while also having richness. This is a wine that should age very well, richly textured with minerality as well as bold black fruits. Drink from 2028.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: From a new vineyard site named for the producers' son, this is immensely rich, rounded and spicy in nutmeg, clove and ginger, completely inviting and immersive on the nose and palate. Made in a balanced, brightly complex style, it offers plenty of depth and nuance between the scenes, in full exploration of crisp to baked apple and pear.
title: Lynmar 2016 Adam's Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine has richness, maturity and intensity. It offers so many complexities and layers of flavor that come together in a red-fruit-flavored, lightly toasty wine that has freshness as well as some age. Drink now.
title: Krug NV 21ème Edition Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: The aromas provide brooding notes of brown stem, soot, freshly ground black pepper, wet rock, tar, grilled asparagus and smoked ham. The flavors are intense and wound up, showing layer upon layer of fruit and savory flavors. A supremely long, savory and floral finish caps it off. It's a complete “wow” wine. Best from 2026 to 2032.
title: Horsepower 2015 Sur Echalas Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: Sourced from a 2008 planting of the Swan clone, rare in Oregon, the new vintage is significantly riper than the 2014. Fermented and aged in 30% new French oak, it shows more of the sweet barrel spices than its stablemates, along with cured meats and muted notes of rock. Tart blackberry and cherry fruit carry the precisely defined core. The wine is stylish, powerful and supremely detailed. This quality at this price is a bargain.
title: Brittan Vineyards 2015 Cygnus Block Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Aromas of snappy pomegranate, smashed pine, dewy chaparral and dried carnation show on the epic nose of this bottling by Chad Melville, who took over winemaking duties on this vintage. It's crisp and bright in feel, where sour cherry, thyme, sage and blistered tomato flavors engage all parts of the palate.
title: 96pointsMelville 2016 Sandy's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a deft, detailed wine, offering a mix of tangy citrus, sweet tea, honeysuckle and lemonade. The sweet-tart mix is terrific, making for a lively palate that keeps inviting the next sip. Drink now–2030.
title: 96pointsJ Wrigley 2017 Estate Riesling (McMinnville)Editors' Choice

description: Concentrated, exotic and almost earthy, this wine from a single vineyard in Anderson Valley has a wild edge of smoked fruit, singed rosemary and black pepper, with a core of deep black-cherry and clove flavors. It is full-bodied, mouthfilling and layered, with nuances that continue to unfold on the evolving finish. Best through 2024.
title: 96pointsKendall-Jackson 2016 Jackson Estate Outland Ridge Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)Cellar Selection

description: Caramelized lemon takes turns with candied lemon to entice the nose. The concentrations of both sweetness and acidity seem to potentiate each other, creating an increasing sense of joy, drama and thrill. The citrus and passion fruit flavors are of immense precision, and one drop on the tongue makes all the taste buds tingle with excitement. This is compact and impactful in all its sweet and tart glory.
title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2015 Beerenauslese Exquisit White (Burgenland)

description: This finely structured wine is powered by fine tannins and rich fruits. A touch of acidity comes through the rich berry flavors and the concentration of the dark tannins. This wine will certainly age, don't drink before 2028.
title: W. & J. Graham's 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: The wine is dense, packed with great fruits and tannins, dark and concentrated, and full of perfumed black fruits. It is a wine that makes a great statement of ripe fruits and tannins for long-term aging. Drink from 2028.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2016 Capela Vintage  (Port)

description: Produced from a small walled vineyard close to the Lanson winery in Reims, this is a splendid wine. Its richness is balanced by the intense freshness and minerality of the Chardonnay, with apple and citrus flavors that still in the background. Now mature, this wine is ready to drink.
title: Lanson 2007 Clos Lanson Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The aromas are haunting, with notes of white and black pepper, peat, potpourri, green olive, orange blossom, grilled asparagus and smoked meat. The palate shows incredible texture and detail, but the story here is truly the finish—a full minute-plus investment worth every thrilling moment. It's hard to tell exactly when it stops. A complete mind- and palate-bending stunner—one of the defining wines of the vintage. Best from 2020–2030.
title: 97pointsHorsepower 2015 Sur Echalas Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (OR))Cellar Selection

description: The purest scent of ripe apricot on the nose unfolds in even more spectacular fashion on the luscious palate. The flavors are carried by the immense, concentrated sweetness but are outlined and put into sharp focus by the crystalline acidity. This is sublimely pure and intense.
title: Türk 2016 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: This magnificent wine celebrates the enormous aging potential of a great Champagne. It is still full of bright red fruits and tense minerality, with only a hint of maturity. While nearing its peak for enjoyment, let it breathe before drinking.
title: Louis Roederer 1995 Cristal Vinothèque Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: The nose of this wine offers heady touches of peony, vanilla, plum and oak leaf. The concentrated palate brings plum, pepper and a slight phenolic edge that helps the acidity corral all of the luscious flavors into a rounded dollop of deliciousness. Drink until 2040.
title: Hager Matthias 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)

description: Very floral, intense and ripe, this is a wine that is based around big black fruits as well as fine acidity. It is obviously destined for long aging with its powerful dry tannins and perfumed acidity. Drink this wine from 2028.
title: Dow's 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: The wine has great swathes of black fruit at the same time as powerful tannins. That makes for a rich balanced wine, destined for long-term aging. There is a floral element that will soften and broaden out to give a satisfyingly ripe, never too sweet, wine. Drink from 2028.
title: Rozes 2016 Quinta do Pégo Vintage  (Port)

description: This bottling brings together a fine structure with great fruit to give a luscious wine that is also destined for long-term aging. With its ripe berry flavors sustained by some acidity, this is already balanced. Drink from 2028
title: Fonseca 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: Pressed rose, iris, new leather, exotic spice, menthol and a whiff of wild berry come to the forefront on this gorgeous wine. The full-bodied polished palate has a weightless elegance, delivering raspberry compote, crushed cherry, licorice, aromatic herb and a floral note alongside taut velvety tannins. It's already beautiful but hold for even more complexity. Drink 2021–2031.
title: Paolo Scavino 2011 Novantesimo Riserva  (Barolo)

description: This finely balanced wine is rich with tannins as well as powerful black fruits. Its mineral texture and perfumes add complexity to the ripeness of the wine. This is a wine for long-term aging, concentrated and dense with great fruits. Drink from 2029.
title: Wine & Soul 2016 Pintas Vintage  (Port)

description: A touch of creaminess on the nose leads to a mellow palate full of honeyed baked apple fruit. There is a hint of vanilla and a bright, almost piercing gleam of wonderful lemon sharpness, putting the creamy decadence of the palate into even more focus. This has ultimate concentration and finishes with such zesty vigor. This is built to last. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Grand Selection Chardonnay (Burgenland)

description: Ripe, structured while also fruity, this intense, perfumed Port is opulent while also elegant. Its tannins and great fruit are finely integrated and are rich with potential. Black fruits, berries and a juicy aftertaste add freshness to the wine. Drink from 2028.
title: Taylor Fladgate 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: A hint of sublimely ripe apricot on the nose draws you in. The aromatic allure continues on the palate, where a gently bitter edge, as of dark fir honey, streaks the gentle notes of fresh and baked apricot. There is a rounded, luscious, almost emollient fluidity that makes this glide across the pleasure centers of your brain, always following with lip-smacking freshness. This leaves sinuous trails across the tongue and brain. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Sattlerhof 2013 Trockenbeerenauslese Morillon (Südsteiermark)

description: An earthy glint precedes the lemony caramel notes that dominate the nose. Honey-drizzled apricots reveal themselves with a second sniff and come on full tilt on the luscious palate. A lovely lemon sharpness along with a delicious streak of bitterness counters the sweetness. Wave upon wave of apricot flavor settles on the tongue, pulsating like an epicenter of pleasure. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 2 Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: This amazing wine is timeless. Just hinting a golden hue, the nose offers layers of toastiness balanced by an impressive amount of fruit and freshness. At 23 years old, it still has some life in it, showing bright citrus and minerality. Let it breathe before drinking to bring out all the subtleties.
title: Louis Roederer 1995 Cristal Vinothèque Brut  (Champagne)

description: A hint of orange peel on the nose has the earthy tang of botrytis along with a leafy, slightly floral lift of honeysuckle. The concentrated sweetness that follows is cut by piercing, lively freshness that seems pervasive, and while cutting into the passion-fruit generosity it also defines and sharpens it. This is tense and concentrated with everything at full volume. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 10 Scheurebe (Burgenland)

description: Compelling aromas of Mediterranean brush, dark spice, pressed flower, graphite and aromatic herb draw you in for more of this elegant red. Focused and intense, it boasts great energy, offering juicy wild cherry, rosemary, white pepper and star anise, framed in bright acidity and extremely refined tannins. It's gorgeous and already enjoyable but will offer a decade or more of exquisite drinking.
title: 98pointsFranchetti–Passopisciaro 2016 Contrada R Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)

description: Vanilla and dried, sweet tobacco leaf wrap baked apple notes in their warm spice. The palate boosts the vanilla even more and unleashes its sweetness with an uncommon creaminess. Cinnamon around the edges tingles as much as the dried and candied orange notes. There almost is a fiery hit of ginger in the lip-smacking finish. A spicy magic potion here that lasts and lasts on the palate. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 5 Traminer (Burgenland)

description: This is a ripe and generous wine, with tannins that are well integrated into the powerful black-fruit core. It is rich in a black plum flavor that's cut by fine acidity. Complex, balanced and full of long-term potential, drink this impressive wine from 2029.
title: 99pointsSandeman 2016 Vintage  (Port)Cellar Selection

description: A touch of smoke, freshly brewed Darjeeling and candied peel of bitter orange unite in a most intriguing nose. The viscous liquid is of an unusual density, brimming at every atom with its barley sugar flavors and caramelized black tea leaf and citrus notes. There is a wonderfully alluring element of bitterness that sets as much of a counterpoint to the otherworldly sweetness as the rapier acidity. The purity of expression is astonishing; concentration and intensity are extraordinary. An elixir. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 11 Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: A ripe wine that has great fruit as well as tannins, this is rich and perfumed. It has a layer of minerality that brings it close to the tough schist of the Douro. At the same time, the rich fruits are generous. The potential is excellent. Drink from 2029.
title: Ferreira 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: A beautifully balanced, rich wine, this has great tannins, a dense, firm texture and luscious blackberry fruits. It shows the structure of the vintage while also bringing a fresher element. Jammy but never cloying, this is an impressive wine for the long term. Drink from 2029.
title: Barão de Vilar 2016 Maynard's Vintage  (Port)

description: This legendary Champagne, only produced in exceptional years, comes from the village of Le Mesnil in the Côte des Blancs. It is made from 100% Chardonnay and aged for many years before release. Its minerality, concentration and beautiful fruit are still astonishingly young and deserve further aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Salon 2007 Le Mesnil Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is a ripe and fruity yet strucutred wine that has amazing aging potential. It offers a strongly floral element that contrasts with the tense, mineral texture and dense tannins. It is an immensely concentrated wine that will not be ready until 2029.
title: Quinta do Noval 2016 Nacional Vintage  (Port)

description: The allure of caramel and smoke hits first, after which a cloud of the purest apricot essence reaches the senses. The viscous palate tingles with disarmingly sharp acidity, balanced by incredibly luscious sweetness. Layer upon layer of apricot, passion fruit and candied lemon unleashes itself in this clean, precise TBA. It offers marvel concentration and purity. Drink until 2040.
title: Sattlerhof 2013 Trockenbeerenauslese Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)

description: Damask rose, honeysuckle and blood orange peel unite in an almost otherworldly headiness. The palate keeps shimmering with these floral overtones while a solid wave of sweetness assails the taste buds with an insisting urgency, only to follow this with a sharp, welcome smack of pure lemon freshness. These notions alternate and fill the head with the pleasure of their tension. Sublime. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 8 Muscat Ottonel (Burgenland)

description: An exquisitely floral honeysuckle aroma surrounds a creamy yet sharp note of passion fruit, while a peppery verve tingles around the edges. The palate has the same playful character: a floral tease here, a full-blown passion-fruit kiss there, a total embrace of sweetness balanced by a sure-footed command of acid that draws everthing together and assembles a newly precise picture with every sip. This is so heady, so delicious, so pure, so moreish that it should be a controlled substance. This should hold well through 2040, at least.
title: 100pointsKracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 4 Scheurebe (Burgenland)Cellar Selection

description: One of the great Champagnes both for its richness and its longevity, this latest incarnation is superb. The wine's richness is linked to the ripe fruit and the dominance of Pinot Noir in the blend. It also shines in the perfect balance between the texture, the minerality and the integration of the fruit. It can be enjoyed now, but it will be better from 2020 and then for many years to come.
title: 100pointsPol Roger 2008 Cuvée Sir Winston Churchill Brut  (Champagne)Cellar Selection

description: On the nose, a hint of dark fir honey shows with a streak of its pleasant bitterness. Fresh notes of apple and lemon zest mix with the earthy notes of botrytis. On the palate, this zestiness unfolds completely, crashing with the full force of its fruit like roaring surf against a rock. That lovely element of noble bitterness still holds sway, creating a sensation of the most intense but also precise sweetness. Drink until 2040, at least.
title: Heidi Schröck 2015 Ruster Ausbruch Auf den Flügeln der Morgenröte Welschriesling (Burgenland)

description: Extreme amounts of freshness arise on the nose of this radical cool-climate Syrah, from smashed plums and boysenberries to amazingly intense peppercorn, forest-floor, tobacco, pine-oil and asphalt aromas. Peppercorns, tar, dark herbs and strong anise flavors show on the intriguing palate.
title: Melville 2016 Donna's Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This understated, elegant study in the variety opens in beguiling aromas of floral rose before opening into a finely made, structured and gracefully constructed wine that's fully in balance. Leather, black cherry and dark chocolate highlight a midpalate of finely polished, tamed tannin and integrated oak. This is delightfully enjoyable now, but can stand up to aging; enjoy best 2020–2030.
title: 97pointsCorison 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)Cellar Selection

description: Truffle, forest floor, wild berry, chopped herb and new leather aromas create an enticing fragrance on this structured, elegant red. Full bodied and loaded with tension, the savory palate delivers succulent morello cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and baking spice set against a backbone of noble tannins. Drink 2020–2032.
title: Germano Ettore 2012 Lazzarito Riserva  (Barolo)

description: Exquisitely pure and aromatic notes of baked pear gleam in the glass along with something heady and ethereal that is reminiscent of freshly cut citrus zest. The off-dry palate has a balm-like viscosity and brings out honeyed ripe Mirabelles, but it all happens at such a gentle clean pure level that this feels like sublimated ripe fruit framed by vivid citrus. Despite some residual sweetness this stays fresh. This is a wine that explains in one small sip and sniff what a good field blend can be all about. It is lovely now and only just starting to evolve. Drink until 2040.
title: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2013 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru White (Alsace)

description: Made from a site planted in the 1950s by the grand wine wizard André Tchelistcheff, this wine is remarkable in its gravelly mineral character and well-managed tannin profile. Soft supple texture is complemented by focused layers of savory red fruit and lifted acidity. Enjoyable now, it has structure to age. Enjoy best 2020–2030.
title: Corison 2015 Sunbasket Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: Enticing aromas of rose, aromatic herb, new leather, truffle and balsamic are just some of what you'll find in this outstanding wine. On the elegant, vibrant palate, bright acidity and polished tannins offset flavors of juicy red cherry, crushed strawberry, rhubarb, clove and white pepper. Drink 2022–2034.
title: 96pointsComm. G. B. Burlotto 2014 Monvigliero  (Barolo)

description: The lifted ethereal notes of freshly crushed chamomile leaves meet with the rounded richness of baked apples on the nose while dried lemon peel hints add freshness. The palate is concentrated and has started to evolve. Fresh citrus and apple have morphed into rounded fruit. Yet the intrinsic freshness of Riesling remains, creating a wonderful mouthfeel together with the viscous concentration. The finish is dry and lasting with a persistent note of lemon. Drink now through 2038.
title: Josmeyer 2014 Hengst Samain Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Charming fruit flavors and great structure come together in this very appealing, well-balanced and concentrated wine. The aroma bursts with red cherry, black cherry and black currants while the flavors add nuances of rhubarb, mild spices and black tea for a complex, delicious effect overall. The wine is full bodied and well scaffolded by moderate tannins and fresh-tasting acidity. Best after 2022.
title: Joseph Jewell 2016 Eel River Valley Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)

description: Intoxicatingly fragrant, this offers heady scents of perfumed berry, pine forest, wild rose, aromatic herb and a balsamic note of eucalyptus. The structured, focused palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, pomegranate, licorice and white pepper set against polished tannins and bright acidity. It's delicious and loaded with energy. Drink 2024–2030.
title: Giacomo Fenocchio 2014 Castellero  (Barolo)

description: A wonderful perfume of cinnamon, black cherries and violets starts this full-bodied wine on a great note, and it follows with rich, ripe and complex fruit and spice flavors. The mouthfeel is generous and broad yet light in tannins, bringing the abundance of flavors into a lingering finish.
title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Angel Camp Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Crisp but tart yellow apple and ripe Amalfi lemon appear on the nose with their lifted, urgent freshness. The palate sticks to this vivid lemony theme while also revealing another dimension of generous juiciness. The palate is streamlined, vivid, dry concentrated and taut, but always with that inkling of more ripeness amidst the lemony zing. Lovely now, certain to evolve. Drink now through 2030.
title: Boeckel 2016 Zotzenberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: A compelling combination of well-integrated oak spices and forward, opulent fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine almost irresistible. It has a smooth texture, layered and concentrated notes of cinnamon, nutmeg, new leather, wood smoke, cooked cherries and ripe plums supported by moderate tannins and good fruit acidity.
title: Arista 2015 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This estate-grown beauty is succulent and supple, with a tense body of bright wild strawberry, crushed rock, dried lavender and Asian spice. Robustly rich and deeply layered in flavor and texture, it finishes in a gorgeous dabble of white pepper.
title: Wayfarer 2016 Wayfarer Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: Red berry, dried rose petal, exotic spice, menthol and a whiff of underbrush take shape in the glass. On the youthfully tense but focused palate, taut refined tannins and vibrant acidity frame raspberry, strawberry, star anise and a hint of espresso. It's already delicious but this shows wonderful aging potential, so hold for even more complexity. Drink 2022–2034.
title: Sandrone 2014 Le Vigne  (Barolo)

description: Produced from vines dating to the 1930s and 1940s, this wine, after eight years, is mature. The vineyard in the Douro Superior has given a superlative wine full of fruit and tannins, with an almost Port-like richness that is opulent and impressive. Drink this wine now.
title: Quinta da Zaralhôa 2010 Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This bottling, which is now known to be Graciano, is very deep in color and shows hearty black plum, purple flower and smoked meat on the focused nose. It's thick on the palate, loaded with vanilla, shaved chocolate, charred beef and wild dark berry, presented atop chalky tannins that are firm yet enveloping.
title: Paix Sur Terre 2016 The Golden Road Monastrell (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

description: A classic, vibrant expression of Nebbiolo, this fragrant red opens with compelling aromas of wild berry, crushed rose, iris, menthol and aromatic herb. Elegant and structured, the linear, savory palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, wild raspberry, licorice and mint alongside bright acidity and firm tannins. Drink 2023–2029.
title: Massolino 2014 Margheria  (Barolo)

description: A library selection of the last vintage made by founder Patrick Campbell from bud break to bottle, this shows the prowess and longevity of the vineyard, a resplendent celebration of leathery black pepper, black cherry and mocha. The secondary characteristics are coming into their own, with a lovely high-wire tension of acidity and freshness just beginning to fade. Drink soon.
title: Laurel Glen 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Mountain)

description: The dried zest of both sweet and bitter oranges lends an almost Mediterranean aspect to the nose of this dry Riesling. The palate continues this play on this zest, pulling further registers of dried mandarin and exquisitely sharp lemon. In the background, somewhere, is a lip-smacking notion of wet stone. This is concentrated and textured, rich but sharply drawn: a perfect picture of the 2014 vintage in all its adult thrill. Drink now through 2038.
title: Josmeyer 2014 Hengst Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: A gentle touch of crushed thyme precedes very pure lemon hints on the nose. The palate fills out with far more luscious citrus, suggesting tart but juicy tangerine and more vivid lemon. The fine and slender structure holds all of this zesty, refreshing fruit with grace and lightness—a wonderfully vivid, bright and utterly citrus-driven wine with a long dry refreshing finish.
title: Joseph Fritsch 2017 Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Seductive hints of apricot play gently about the still shy nose. The palate is a sphere of vivid contained juiciness—of apricot aromatics and richness framed by the most vivid zesty lemon. Tingling and playful on the surface, this has a serious profound core of fruit and a taut superclean structure. The finish is dry and refreshing. Drink until 2038.
title: Jean Biecher & Fils 2017 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Bold aromas of flowers, ripe berries and cassis carry the exotic nose. This bottling from the renowned García family is intense, tight and structured like a brick house. Boysenberry, blackberry and chocolaty oak are the most notable flavors, while this oozes coffee, toast and peppery spice on a hard-driving but focused finish. Drink from 2020–2038.
title: Garmón 2015  Ribera del Duero

description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this focused red boasts enticing scents of crushed herb, rose petal, forest floor, woodland berry and a whiff of menthol. It's savory and incredibly elegant, delivering juicy raspberry, strawberry compote and star anise alongside a savory, almost salty note. Lithe polished tannins and bright acidity provide support and impeccable balance. Drink 2022–2032.
title: Figli Luigi Oddero 2014 Rocche Rivera  (Barolo)

description: The nose has a subtle array of aromas. A touch of ripe Mirabelle plum alongside a herbal touch of crushed sage, lovely lemon zestiness and a creamy mellowness. All of these are layered with immense charm on an utterly precise crystalline structure. This is as clear as a bell, concentrated, sunny and ripe but also taut and fresh. The finish is dry and utterly mouthfilling. Lovely. Drink until 2035.
title: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Sommerberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: This gorgeous red opens with classic aromas of forest floor, wild berry, crushed herb, blue flower and a whiff of menthol. It's all about structure and finesse, delivering succulent Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice, baking spice and crushed mint flavors. Bright acidity and firm, polished tannins give it wonderful balance and a smooth texture. Drink 2022–2034.
title: Massolino 2014 Parafada  (Barolo)

description: Savory notes of bramble, smoke and leather juxtapose forward plum, cherry and strawberry in this full-bodied wine. It's a penetrating, mouthfilling sip that lingers on the palate, finishing on soft, furry tannins. Approachable already, this concentrated wine should improve through 2025 and hold further.
title: Domaine du Pegau 2015 Cuvée Réservée Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

description: This enticing wine has aromas of black cherries, rose petals and black tea followed by blackberry, rhubarb, clove and cedar flavors that mingle on the palate. A very firm texture of moderate tannins and good fruit acidity keeps it lively in terms of mouthfeel, and the concentration carries through a lingering finish. Best now–2025.
title: Brooks Note 2015 Pinot Noir (Marin County)

description: A deep purple color and equally deep aromas of wild berry and blueberry open this lush Malbec from one of Cobos's newest vineyards in the Valle de Uco. A sensuous palate is dense but balanced, with a bit more freshness than this label is known for. Mocha, chocolate and black-fruit flavors are steady on a smooth finish. Drink this superb Malbec through 2030.
title: 96pointsViña Cobos 2015 Bramare Chañares Estate Malbec (Valle de Uco)Cellar Selection

description: Softly scented freshness has hints of lemon zest and ripe yellow apple. On the palate, these flavors unfold and are joined by a well of creamy depth that lends another dimension to freshness and fruit. This echoes with richness and aromatic complexity: stone, earth, yeast and citrus create layers of flavor and expression. Savor this, and let it happen to you. The finish is seemingly endless. Lovely now, certain to develop. Drink 2018–2028.
title: Wiston Estate Winery 2009 Cuvée Brut  (England)

description: Both the heady honeysuckle and Amalfi lemon notes on the nose seem to benefit from still being tinged with flinty reduction. The palate is intense and comes in with concentrated lemon zestiness that tingles across the taste buds. A smoky stoniness provides a solid and bold backdrop for hints of peach and more florals. This seems to have elixir-like power and prowess. Its central vein of smoky lemon zest makes you go back for more. This needs bottle age but promises to be sensational. Drink 2025–2035.
title: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Rangen de Thann Clos Saint Urbain Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: A touch of flint hovers above the fragrance of freshly cut citrus-peel notes that are reminiscent of clementine and tangerine. On the palate the tangy, zesty notes play first fiddle but they are supported by a whole orchestra of juicy clementine and tangerine flesh. This is ripe freshness or fresh ripeness of fruit that comes with a disarming playfulness and well-honed generosity. The dry lip-smacking tangerine finish makes you crave more.
title: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Brand Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Both fresh lemon and lemon oil appear on the nose, with an added alluring notion of smoky nettle and fragrant citrus foliage. The palate is concentrated, powerful, searing almost with its freshness and impact. All the volcanic power and depth of the vineyard seems to explode into notions of zesty citrus here. Powerful is the word. The finish is dry and lasting. Drink now through 2040.
title: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Rangen Clos Saint-Théobald Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Smoky, earthy, anise and dark-chocolate aromas give way to concentrated, layered black-plum, clove and blackberry flavors as this full-bodied wine seems to expand on the palate. Its texture is richly tannic and the mouthfeel is generous, prolonging the lush flavors on the finish. A perennial standout, this wine has proven it can age well. Best after 2025.
title: 96pointsTerre Rouge 2015 Ascent Syrah (Sierra Foothills)Cellar Selection

description: Distinctive aromas of toasted nut and wood-smoke give this full-bodied wine an exotic start, while baked apple, browned walnut and crisp cherry flavors continue the theme. Made from 82% Pinot Noir and 18% Chardonnay, it offers layers of spice, smoke and mild, savory mushroom and tea flavors, surrounded by a plush, creamy texture and light acidity to keep it fresh. Best after 2023.
title: Schramsberg 2009 Reserve Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Deep aromas of candied black cherries, ginger snaps, star anise and iron-laced soils are rich and inviting on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Boisterous, energetic flavors of red fruit meet with cinnamon, annatto and, on the finish, the buzz of Sichuan peppercorn. Drink 2020–2030.
title: 96pointsRoar 2016 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)Cellar Selection

description: A totally floral touch, almost of elderflower, plays on the nose before aromatic citrus hints take over. On the taut concentrated palate, they express themselves as tangy grapefruit, vivid ripe lemon and subtle Meyer lemon. The structure underneath them is crystalline, pure and fine. The finish is a dry sublime sense of lemon purity. This has real lasting impact. Drink now through 2040.
title: Julien Schaal 2017 Sommerberg Granite Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: New leather, truffle, camphor and dried aromatic herb aromas lead the nose. On the smooth, generous palate, velvety fine-grained tannins uphold crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry, licorice and cinnamon. A hint of tangerine zest lingers on the long, smooth finish. Delicious! Drink 2020–2032.
title: Figli Luigi Oddero 2012 Rocche Rivera  (Barolo)

description: A mellow creaminess frames crisp, tart but ripe red-apple notes. The palate swings with that same creaminess but adds something deeply salty and savory to the fruity mix. There is something of tamed wilderness here, and lots of drive and individuality. Firm citrus zestiness anchors everything in brightness but the layer of fruity, creamy and salty notions makes you want to continue sipping. The finish is dry, clean, savory and so long. Drink now through 2030.
title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2016 Hengst Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: This opens with an enticing intense bouquet of crushed mint, rose petal, violet, perfumed berry and a whiff of dark spice. Elegantly structured, the vibrant, savory palate delivers strawberry compote, crushed raspberry, licorice and cinnamon framed in taut polished tannins. It's nicely balanced, with bright acidity. It's already tempting, but give it time to develop even more complexity. Drink 2021–2033.
title: Borgogno 2013 Liste  (Barolo)

description: Rose petal, truffle, exotic spice, camphor and new leather are just some of the aromas you'll encounter on this drop-dead gorgeous wine. It's round, full-bodied and juicy, offering delicious flavors of Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and tobacco. Polished tannins provide support while fresh acidity lends balance. Drink 2020–2028.
title: Borgogno 2013 Cannubi  (Barolo)

description: A touch of flinty reduction plays on the nose. The palate then presents bright citrus zest with wonderfully bitter citrus pith as well as a salty intensity that is reminiscent of preserved lemon. All this is couched in ripe expressive pear fruit on a concentrated but sinuous body that seems to have inherent drive. It is the pith and the zest that make this. The finish is dry and lasting. Drink 2025–2030.
title: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Rangen de Thann Clos Saint Urbain Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: Aromas of camphor, crushed berry, dried rose, new leather and red berry form the quintessential Nebbiolo nose on this stunning ethereal wine. Elegantly structured and loaded with tension, the radiant palate delivers juicy red cherry, cranberry, star anise and tobacco framed in firm polished tannins. It's beautifully balanced, with bright acidity. It's already drinking beautifully but hold for even more complexity. Drink 2020–2040.
title: Mascarello Giuseppe e Figlio 2010 Cà d'Morissio  (Barolo)

description: Exquisitely pure lime zest and lemon notes leap from the glass. You can virtually smell the zing that will hit and delight your taste buds. The palate presents the citrus notions in layers of slatey stone, adding a smoky dark allure to the brightness of the lemon. This is high-octane stuff of wonderful concentration. The finish is dry and long and reveals a most aromatic streak of blood-orange freshness. Drink now–2035.
title: Marc Kreydenweiss 2016 Kastelberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: This is 100% varietal and packed in flavor and body. Low yields make for a densely rich and concentrated experience on the palate—an intense, slightly reduced tangle of chocolate, caramel and dusty compressed black fruit. Earthy, it flaunts crushed rock, gravel and graphite elements, with a streak of fresh acidity on the finish. Enjoy best 2025–2030.
title: Larkmead 2015 Solari Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Lime, lemon and bergamot zest tantalize on the nose with their shimmering nuances of green and yellow freshness. The palate adds a textured backdrop that has something of citrus pith, providing a layer against which this vivid zestiness can play out. There is substance and depth and wonderful purity. The finish is dry and those flashes of aromatic citrus peel continue throughout. Wonderful. Drink now through 2035.
title: René Muré 2016 Clos St Landelin Vorbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Elegant and fragrant, this radiant wine opens with classic Nebbiolo aromas of forest floor, crushed herb, dried rose, wild berry and a whiff of new leather. The focused, ethereal palate sneaks up on you, offering red cherry, spiced cranberry, wild strawberry and licorice alongside firm, refined tannins. Bright acidity lends balance, energy and tension. It's still youthfully austere so give it time to develop even more complexity. Drink 2023–2033.
title: Mascarello Giuseppe e Figlio 2013 Monprivato  (Barolo)

description: Forest floor, dried rose petal, new leather, star anise and menthol aromas align with a potpourri of dark cooking spice. The full-bodied yet linear palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed strawberry, licorice and aromatic herb set against taut, elegant tannins. Vibrant acidity lends balance, tension and an ageworthy structure. Drink 2023–2038.
title: Elvio Cogno 2013 Ravera Bricco Pernice  (Barolo)

description: The nose holds an intriguing, dual appeal. On the one hand there is the breezy, ozonic freshness of crushed citrus leaves and their ethereal oils, on the other there is bountiful, juicy but gentle stone fruit. These opposing poles unite on nose and palate to create a lovely tension on a very taut, but juicy palate. This has so much fruit and depth that you want to delve ever deeper into these flavors. The lemon and apricot finish endures and entices. Lovely now, certain to evolve. Drink now–2035.
title: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Muenchberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Made only in exceptional vintages, the Cuvée da Capo is a powerful, deeply nuanced wine pulsating with fruit and earth complexities. Black-cherry and red-plum flavors are alluring and ripe yet tinged by veins of moss, smoke and fur. It's soft and silky on the palate yet composed. The finish is long and lifted. Gorgeous already it will improve through 2030 and hold further.
title: Domaine du Pegau 2015 Cuvée da Capo Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

description: Enticing aromas of toasted almond and pear tart lead to an equally seductive and complex palate that is dry but rich in feel. It has the complexity and layering of a wine aged a long time on the yeast, and shows excellent concentration that leads to a long, lingering finish. This is Schramsberg's top-of-the-line Chardonnay-based wine and it definitely lives up to its billing in this vintage. Best after 2023.
title: 97pointsSchramsberg 2009 J. Schram Sparkling (North Coast)Cellar Selection

description: The Franscioni family is making some of the best wines on the Central Coast, as evidenced in this bottling, which shows tremendous concentration without being overripe or overextracted. Aromas of purple and red flowers meet with minty tarragon and pine needle on the nose, while the palate's black cherry and boysenberry flavors are lifted by touches of eucalyptus and pine needle.
title: Roar 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: With a tiny 3% addition of Cabernet Franc, this wine is defined by aromas of violet and crushed rock. Oak, clove and graphite dot a landscape of bold structure on the palate, with bright acidity balancing the concentration and grip. Enjoy 2025–2030.
title: Larkmead 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of underbrush, camphor, new leather and forest berry form the nose. It's full bodied and firmly structured, offering Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and a hint of exotic incense. Youthfully assertive but noble tannins and vibrant acidity provide the ageworthy backbone. Drink 2025–2035.
title: Mascarello Giuseppe e Figlio 2013 Perno Vigna Santo Stefano  (Barolo)

description: Gentle but aromatic notes of ripe pear have a welcome edge of lemon zest about them on the nose. On the palate the full force of the fruit becomes apparent. There are tropical overtones of wonderfully tart passion fruit while ripe tangy citrus holds sway with the pervasive freshness of tangerine and orange. This is intense, supremely aromatic, straight as an arrow and very concentrated. The finish is bold and dry with a long zesty echo. Gorgeous now but full of potential. Drink now through 2040.
title: Josmeyer 2015 Hengst Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: An intriguing nose combines smoke, flint, crushed citrus leaves and aromatic bergamot zest. The palate picks up some of those same ethereal citrus notes and underlines them with ripe Amalfi lemon freshness and more juicy ripe citrus like mandarin and aromatic tangerine. This is concentrated, alive, and electric with all manner of citrus and a vivid force of life. What a joy to drink now— hard to resist in fact—but this being dry Riesling we know that this has even more pleasure in store. Drink now–2035.
title: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Rangen de Thann Clos Saint Urbain Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Underbrush, new leather, forest berry, dark spice and a whiff of fragrant blue flower are just some of the aromas you'll encounter on this gorgeous, multifaceted red. Structured but exceedingly elegant, the delicious palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and tobacco. It's impeccably balanced, with noble tannins that lend tension and a velvety texture. Drink 2022–2032.
title: Massolino 2012 Vigna Rionda  (Barolo)

description: Both delicate and flavorful, this exceptional wine defines elegance. It starts with a subtly spicy ginger-cookie aroma that leads to layers of citrus, baking spices and toasted bread on the rich palate. After 18 years since the vintage, this still offers persistent, fine bubbles, bracing acidity and a fresh mouthfeel.
title: Schramsberg 2000 J. Schram Late Disgorged Sparkling (North Coast)

description: From the stellar 2010 vintage, this gorgeous wine lives up to the year's lofty reputation. It opens with enticing scents of dried rose petal, truffle, crushed aromatic herb, woodland berry and a whiff of tar. On the full-bodied elegantly structured palate, star anise, mint, tobacco and a hint of mineral add depth to a juicy red-berry core. It's beautifully balanced, with bright acidity and taut silky tannins. Drink 2020–2040.
title: Michele Chiarlo 2010 Cerequio Riserva  (Barolo)

description: A blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Cabernet Franc, this is a tremendous wine, offering grippy red-currant, tobacco and graphite components around a full-bodied core of weight and breadth. Powerful yet elegant, it retains and celebrates much of the Cab Franc character in its unabashed embrace of dried herb, clove and violet. Enjoy 2025–2030.
title: Larkmead 2015 Salon Red (Napa Valley)

description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this stunning red showcases Barolo's elegant side. It opens with enticing scents of rose, violet, perfumed berry and menthol while the radiant palate delivers cherry, cranberry, star anise and baking spice. It's impeccably balanced, with taut silky tannins and bright acidity that lend compelling tension. Absolutely gorgeous! Drink 2023–2043.
title: Cantina Bartolo Mascarello 2013  Barolo

description: Earthy and complex, this deeply concentrated wine offers bold black-cherry and preserved-strawberry flavors against a backdrop of mushroom, bramble and spice. It's a voluptuous red with gentle acidity and smooth, velvety tannins. The finish is savory and long. Delicious already it should improve through 2025 and hold longer.
title: Château Maucoil 2015 L'Esprit de Maucoil Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

description: A subtle hint of wet stone and sourdough has the faintest idea of honey about it. The autolytic richness suggested on the nose is countered on the palate by pure, lively and lemony freshness. The fizz is very fine and creamy but you get the idea that this is still a bit young and needs more bottle age. This wine's appeal is about soil and place rather than up-front fruit. The harmonious finish is dry and long. Grant this some bottle age and then enjoy the classy creaminess this promises. Drink 2020–2028.
title: Nyetimber 2013 Tillington Single Vineyard  (England)

description: Earthy, grainy and decisively herbal, this wine integrates its wealth of tannin and oak well, allowing for a soft palate of rich round cassis and forest pine. Exotic, it intrigues in its mix of refinement and robust power, allowing air for the acidity to breathe. Enjoy best 2025–2030.
title: Sunshine Valley Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: The sharp direct lift of purest lemon essence shoots into the nose before revealing a honeyed edge suggesting evolution and fruit. The palate stays on this concentrated theme and presents the thrill of the 2014 vintage without hiding behind sweetness. There is a wonderful backdrop of chalkiness and stone. This is dry, concentrated, and spiky but nonetheless festooned with dried apple, ripe pear and lip-smacking lemon. For adults only. Drink now–2038.
title: Domaine Jean Sipp 2014 Kirchberg de Riebauvillé Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: An exotic hint of passion flower and ivy leaf hovers over the Mirabelle notes on the nose. The palate comes in with a flash of lemon brightness that is incisive and sonorous at the same time. The body is concentrated and rich with the flavor of ripe fruit while remaining dry and centered around that lovely, bright and appetizing acid. The finish has hints of wet stone and a lip-smacking moreish brightness. This is lovely now but will evolve beautifully. Drink until 2030.
title: 95pointsMarc Kreydenweiss 2016 Moenchberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)Cellar Selection

description: A 100% varietal, 100% barrel-fermented wine, given nearly two years in French oak, 70% of it new, this shows off the St. Helena site well, in its tight-grained intensity and smooth sizable tannins. Dried herb, lavender, black licorice and dark cherry coulis complement each other well, providing complexity and balance against the full-bodied concentration. Enjoy best 2024–2034.
title: The Debate 2014 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Blended with 10% Merlot, 4% Cabernet Franc and 2% Malbec by winemaker Jean Hoefliger, this wine opens in a reductive whir of sticky tannin, red berry and cassis before finding a treasure trove of hidden clove and black pepper. Structured and fulsome, it's lengthy and complex, with complexity to spare. Enjoy now or in time; best 2025–2030.
title: Sunshine Valley Vineyards 2015 Jubilee Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This complex and mature wine shows how interesting and layered a fine sparkling wine can become with time. It was aged on the yeast lees for the extremely long period of 16 years before disgorging. Honey, butterscotch and grilled baguette aromas give way to rich mellow fruit and spice flavors and a creamy, mouth-filling texture livened by fine bubbles and mild acidity.
title: Schramsberg 2001 Reserve Late Disgorged Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Violet, rose petal, dried hay, grilled herb and balsamic aromas all merge together on this delicious red. Full bodied and elegantly structured, the tight savory palate delivers wild strawberry, crushed raspberry, tobacco and star anise alongside firm refined tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance and tension. Drink 2023–2033.
title: Rivetto 2013 Briccolina  (Barolo)

description: Both ripe and tart red-apple notions perfume the nose against a subtle backdrop of yeasty richness. On the palate, a fine mousse disperses these flavors and adds the most subtle hint of honey to them. This is classy and restrained, rich but toned, tart but moreish with its sustained note of pure freshness. This wonderful rendition of really fine English fizz has a lasting finish. This will continue developing. Drink now–2025.
title: Redfold Vineyards LLP 2010 Ambriel Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (England)

description: Winemaker Dan Petroski coaxed small yields to make this 100% varietal wine from a warm drought-year vintage marked by concentration and scarcity. Densely spicy, leathery and tobacco-laden, with quiet, dusty black fruit, this structured red is abundant in cocoa powder and crushed rock elements. This wine is worth cellaring; enjoy best 2025–2030.
title: Larkmead 2015 The Lark Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Just tender notes of freshly cut lemon peel reach the nose. A little more air reveals a touch of heady lime. The clean-cut palate sticks to this taut lime and lemon scheme with incisive freshness and tingling zingy tanginess. Cool freshness seems like a vein at the core of this taut, restrained and fresh wine. The finish is dry and clean. This will need time to unfurl its full force of citrus. Drink 2020–2038.
title: Julien Schaal 2017 Rosacker Calcaire Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: This extraordinary wine sets a high standard for California's Humboldt County. An intriguing tension between ripeness and tartness gives this wine great balance, while red and black cherries, rhubarb and subtle oak spices provide plenty of complexity. The wine is medium bodied, has firm tannins to stiffen the mouthfeel just enough and is quite concentrated without being heavy.
title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Ryan VIneyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)

description: Both ripe aromatic apple and fresh orange zest rise from the glass. On the palate, however, far more expansive, tangy and tingling citrus notes take over. Ripe lemon and tangerine zest are expressed with a clarion-like precision and reverberate from start to dry vivid finish. The body is concentrated, taut and majestic. Delicious now but with a great future. Drink now through 2040.
title: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2015 Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Before the zesty lime reaches the nose, there is an almost decadent streak of apricot in demerara sugar. On the palate, however, it is the zing of citrus that asserts itself with exquisite speed and ease. It colonizes mouth and mind with its swirls of ripe bright pure lemon. It makes you smack your lips with its concentration, freshness and zip. There is lots of verve here. The finish is dry and driven, full of energy. Drink now through 2038.
title: Jean Biecher & Fils 2017 Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Underbrush, tobacco, toasted hazelnut, menthol and grilled herb aromas slowly take shape on this focused red. On the structured elegant palate, taut refined tannins and fresh acidity provide an ageworthy framework for raspberry compote, juicy Marasca cherry, orange zest, white pepper and star anise. It already has layers of depth and loads of finesse, but hold for even more complexity. Drink 2022–2030.
title: Gaja 2014 Sperss  (Barolo)

description: A touch of linden blossom precedes the fresh fragrant lemon hints on the nose. The taut palate then presents a picture of bright pure lemon freshness that expands with its citric allure across mouth and mind. This is pure, concentrated and of wonderful purity. The finish is dry and showcases the distinct lovely lemon notes. Drink now through 2038.
title: Emile Beyer 2017 Eichberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Made from biodynamic estate-grown grapes, this is a powerful, intense offering from an Abruzzo icon. A heady mix of Thai basil, anise seed and purple flowers meld within a dense wild berry core. The palate is broad and gripping in youthful tannins, yet plush with a thick-skinned dark berry tone, and speckled notes of herbs and game that linger on the extended finish. Drink 2022–2030.
title: Emidio Pepe 2010  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

description: A touch of demerara sugar spiciness clings to the orange-peel and apple notes of the nose before more and more lemon shifts into focus. The palate also has that edge of decadent richness before lemon zestiness takes over, resulting in an aromatic, intriguing and zesty wine of concentration. There is some power at work here, shining through the citric nuances with concentration and weight. The finish is dry and fresh. Drink now through 2030.
title: Domaines Schlumberger 2015 Kessler Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Juicy lively tangerine notes dominate on the inviting nose. On he palate this juicy tanginess continues with constant veering between fruity richness of ripe flesh and zesty tart peel. There is an underlying freshness here that shines through all of the fruitful generosity and fills mouth and mind with swirling clouds of ripe citrus. The finish is dry, the body is concentrated and intense, the structure is of vivid freshness. Lovely now, certain to evolve. Drink now through 2038.
title: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2015 Rosacker Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: A warm and sunny notion of ripe yellow pear and baked apple plays aromatically on the nose. The merest sniff of light blossom honey adds an edge of richness. The medium-sweet palate seems to be carried by ethereal lemon-spiked baked pear. This is fluid and almost viscous, but also fresh and concentrated. There is something rounded and balm-like about this and one is reminded almost of a fruitful caress. What a lovely expression of all that is special about Alsace.
title: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2013 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru White (Alsace)

description: Dried hay flowers and wild thyme give an aromatic touch to the nose of dried lemon peel and apple. The just off-dry palate tinges the rounded but fresh palate with insinuations of richness. Some honeyed pear there, some dried sultana there, but lemony freshness counters this every time. This interplay and tension makes this not only exciting but fun. This is concentrated, complex and utterly delicious. Lovely now but sure to continue evolving. Drink now–2038.
title: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2014 Sporen Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: This lovely radiant Barolo is another showstopper despite the difficulties of the cool wet vintage. It's incredibly elegant, with alluring scents of perfumed blue flower, rose petal, woodland berry and a whiff of menthol. The focused graceful palate boasts fantastic tension, showing wild strawberry, crushed raspberry, star anise and cinnamon framed in taut polished tannins and vibrant acidity. It's already enjoyable but will also offer good mid-term aging. Drink through 2034.
title: Cantina Bartolo Mascarello 2014  Barolo

description: Alluring notes of ripe citrus shine in the glass. There is mandarin, clementine as well as something fresh and green like crushed citrus foliage. The palate reprises this panoply of ripe citrus in a joyful fashion, with ease but also with concentration and verve. There is lightness in its step and vivid but ripe citrus freshness that makes the taste buds tingle. The finish is dry and lip-smacking.
title: Bott Frères 2016 Osterberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Freshly cut lemon peel, with all its tanginess and ripe richness, informs the nose. The palate joins in with equal lemony enthusiasm. This has drive and verve and channels its ripeness in that bright lively lemon fluidity. Underneath is a textured concentration reminding us of the stony soil. This is a lovely, dry, taut, lip-smacking and ageworthy Riesling. Drink now through 2035.
title: Bott Frères 2016 Kirchberg de Riebauvillé Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: A pure berry nose of black and blue fruits is rich, a touch jammy and oh so inviting. On the palate, this is tight and firm, and far less thick than Cobos wines of the past. Blackberry and lightly toasted oak flavors are direct and generous, and this Malbec from the Uco Valley is laser focused on the finish. Drink through 2030.
title: Viña Cobos 2015 Bramare Zingaretti Estate Malbec (Valle de Uco)

description: Dried rose, blue flower, aromatic herb, wild berry and a whiff of pipe tobacco are just some of the aromas you'll find on this stunning red. It's elegant and structured, delivering raspberry compote, crushed strawberry, cinnamon and star anise framed in bright acidity and firm fine-grained tannins. It has fantastic tension and energy, and promises to age well for years. Drink 2024–2039.
title: Sandrone 2014 Aleste  (Barolo)

description: The perfume of ripe but tart Cox's Orange Pippin apples is pervaded by zesty lemon. Crushed citrus foliage adds a tangy but aromatic edge that is played out even more on the juicy, dry, taut palate. There is something crystalline about the clarity of the lemon freshness, yet there is a deep well of riper citrus at the core. The full-flavored apple reappears on the dry, tangy and lip-smacking finish. Drink until 2035.
title: Marc Kreydenweiss 2016 Wiebelsberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: This 100% varietal wine is fresh and inviting in its nose of exotic spice and blackberry bramble. A dusty texture of soft supple tannin is interwoven effortlessly in dark chocolate, caramel, violet and crushed rock. This wine is structured to age but also well worth enjoying now.
title: Larkmead 2015 Dr. Olmo Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: The faintest hint of elderflower touches upon the subtle lemon-peel notes on the nose before riper hints of orange appear. The palate comes with real impact but on a very filigree-fine structure that uses lemon zest both as a structural base for freshness and as a swirling aromatic highlight. This is lovely, sinuous, long and concentrated, slender but impactful and rather elegant. Lovely. Drink now through 2040.
title: Julien Schaal 2017 Kastelberg Schiste Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: The brightness of pure lemon zest carries with it a hint of candied bergamot, spelling richness and promise. The concentrated palate then delivers tingling lively tart citrus in spades. The lemon freshness takes over and defines the entire concentrated palate with its pervasive electric freshness. This pulls no punches and is uncompromisingly fresh and dry. If you need real jolting refreshment this is it. This is dry and totally vivid. Drink through 2038.
title: Jean Biecher & Fils 2017 Sommerberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)

description: Lime and lemon zest on the nose promise refreshment and tang.
